A Domestic Longhair cat may display characteristics commonly associated with other friendly cat breeds such as independence, curiosity, and intelligence.
Some Domestic Longhair cats can be friendly and playful while others may be shy and quiet, independent, or aloof.
Each Domestic Longhair cat has its own unique personality, but they are generally mild-mannered felines.
Domestic Longhair cats tend to be active and playful with a strong prey drive, requiring plenty of play and exercise.
The Domestic Longhair cat has a thick, double coat of fur that is generally two inches long or more.
Basic care for Domestic Longhair cats includes regular grooming, especially during seasonal shedding periods.
Longhaired cats, in particular, need weekly brushing to maintain healthy coats.
Physical features and grooming requirements of Domestic Longhair cats can vary depending on their breeds.
Domestic Longhair cats may have different temperaments and reactions to various situations, with some being shy or timid.
Fear in cats can have various facets and may not always be easy to recognize.
